Jamar Loza's second-half hat-trick inspired Maidstone to a come-from-behind 4-2 win at Woking which lifted them above their opponents into 19th place in the National League.

Write a short summary for the following passage:
Delano Sam-York and Jamie Lucas put the home side 2-0 in front in the first half before Loza and Yemi Odubade earned Maidstone victory - and left the Cards a point above the relegation zone.
Maidstone goalkeeper Lee Worgan pulled off a fine save to deny Kane Ferdinand after 12 minutes but a minute later he could do nothing to stop Sam-Yorke's effort putting the home side ahead.
Lucas doubled their lead before Maidstone pulled one back shortly afterwards through a fine strike by Loza.
Maidstone's Jamie Coyle hit the inside of a post before Loza slotted in a second from close range.
He completed his treble after the hosts failed to clear Reece Prestedge's free-kick and Odubade fired in a fourth with seven minutes to go.
Match report supplied by the Press Association.
Match ends, Woking 2, Maidstone United 4.
Second Half ends, Woking 2, Maidstone United 4.
Substitution, Maidstone United. George Oakley replaces Joe Pigott.
Substitution, Maidstone United. Harry Phipps replaces Jamar Loza.
Yemi Odubade (Maidstone United) is shown the yellow card.
Goal!  Woking 2, Maidstone United 4. Yemi Odubade (Maidstone United).
Substitution, Woking. Zak Ansah replaces Jake Caprice.
Goal!  Woking 2, Maidstone United 3. Jamar Loza (Maidstone United).
Goal!  Woking 2, Maidstone United 2. Jamar Loza (Maidstone United).
Substitution, Maidstone United. Yemi Odubade replaces Jack Paxman.
Substitution, Woking. Fabio Saraiva replaces Ismail Yakubu.
Substitution, Woking. Gozie Ugwu replaces Jamie Lucas.
Jake Caprice (Woking) is shown the yellow card.
Reece Prestedge (Maidstone United) is shown the yellow card.
Second Half begins Woking 2, Maidstone United 1.
